definition: to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
distributing money, fighting for virtue (idiom); fig. generous in helping the needy
to be chivalrous

sentences.english: So, dear young people, please speak up for peace.
sentences.chinese: 所以，亲爱的青年朋友，请为和平仗义执言。

sentences.english: Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
sentences.chinese: 但还是要为几个弱者而仗义。

sentences.english: Only this sturdy person dared speak boldly to uphold justice, may be able to affect people.
sentences.chinese: 只有这位坚强的人敢仗义执言，也许能感动人民。

sentences.english: The reflection of the property on novel is to eliminate the bullies and help the down-trodden chivalrously.
sentences.chinese: 这种性质在小说上的反映就是行侠仗义和锄强扶弱。

sentences.english: Woman : I really like that you're such a loyal friend.
sentences.chinese: 我就喜欢你这种仗义朋友型的。

sentences.english: The people are very generous to say for gold makeup guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 皓月等人都很仗义的说愿意替金素颜担保。

sentences.english: You need also to be clear of your own motives in speaking to your friend.
sentences.chinese: 同时你还要弄清自己仗义执言的动机。

sentences.english: It is loyal to maintain network world free equal chivalrous person while being chivalrous while being competent if another is but.
sentences.chinese: 另一套却是，仗义行侠维护网络世界自由平等的侠客。

definition: to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
spirit of loyalty and self-sacrifice/code of brotherhood/also pr. [yi4 qi5]
affectionate and true/loyal (idiom)
supremely honorable and righteous
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
(coll.) to be a true friend
chivalrous/chivalry/knight-errantry
public-spirited
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
warmhearted/willing to help others
lit. to intervene when one sees an injustice (idiom)/fig. to rush to the rescue/to play the white knight
pinyin: lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4

definition: straightforward/outspoken
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
see 路見不平，拔刀相助|路见不平，拔刀相助[lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4]
to be chivalrous
outspoken and straightforward/forthright/expansive
